heading: Is Tempeh gluten free?
intro: This public analysis report explains the biggest gluten risks in Tempeh and how to order more safely.

verdict.summary: Tempeh itself is made from fermented soybeans and is generally gluten-free; however, cross-contamination during processing or the use of gluten-containing marinades can pose a risk. It's important to verify the source and preparation methods to ensure safety for those with coeliac disease.

disclaimer: This guidance is informational only. Always verify ingredients and preparation with the restaurant.

sections.title: Quick answer
sections.body: Tempeh can vary by recipe, ingredients, and cross-contact controls in the kitchen.

sections.title: Common gluten risks
sections.body: Watch for hidden sources like soy sauce, malt flavoring, marinades, thickeners, and shared fryers.

faq.question: What should I ask a restaurant?
